intro: Pepinia limae, commonly known as the lima pepinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has woody stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
